required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Proteomics and Metallomics in Cerebral Vasospasm Following Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Proteomics and Metallomics in Cerebral Vasospasm Following Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York - Upstate Medical University

clinical_study.source: State University of New York - Upstate Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the role of Proteomics and Metallomics in Cerebral Vasospasm following Subarachnoid Hemorrhage

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: For the duration of CSF drainage, or until the 21st day after admission.
For the duration of CSF drainage, or until the 21st day after admission.

arm_group.description: Patients admitted with the diagnosis of aneurismal subarachnoid hemorrhage (SAH) and cerebral angiogram negative SAH who would need to have the external ventricular drain (EVD) placed for the management of hydrocephalus.
Patients with non-hemorrhagic brain pathology such as posterior fossa tumor or stroke who will have the CSF sampling for diagnostic or therapeutic purposes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non traumatic SAH documented by CT scan
- Patient with SAH who would need external ventricular drain (EVD) for the management of hydrocephalus
- Patients with normal pressure Hydrocephalus that require an external drain
- Control (non - hemorrhagic) group - CSF collected from patients with posterior fossa tumor or stroke with EVD in place for the management of hydrocephalus.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recent infection within last 1 month of presentation- can increase inflammatory markers
- Recent surgery or acute myocardial infarction within last 1 month of presentation
- Age > 89 years or < 18 years

facility.name: State University of New York Upstate Medical University
